channel.title: Worldwide Newton Conference
channel.description: A sporadically annual gathering of Newton aficionados.
channel.dc:creator: grant@splorp.com

item.title: Paul Guyot's WWNC Presentation on YouTube
item.description: Thanks to Adam Tow and Sir Izaac, Paul Guyot's WWNC presentation entitled Einstein and Relativity: The Transition is now available for viewing on YouTube. For those of you who missed out on the festivities, it's well worth the wait.
item.dc:subject: News

item.title: Presentations Now Available
item.description: The majority of the presentations from the 2006 Worldwide Newton Conference program are now available in PDF format from the resources page. Additional information from the conference, as well as the remaining presentations will be posted shortly. Thank you for your patience.
item.dc:subject: News

item.title: Conference Program
item.description: The conference program will include presentations by Walter Smith, James Joaquin, Paul Guyot, Larry Yaeger, Ronnie Simon, Adam Tow, Grant Hutchinson and others. Expert panel discussions, informal 'how-to' sessions, and demonstrations of the latest software developments for the Newton platform are also planned.
item.dc:subject: News

item.title: Conference Registration Now Open
item.description: Why wait? Register online right now. See who else is attending.
item.dc:subject: News

item.title: Conference Venue
item.description: The conference will take place at the The Warwick Regis Hotel in downtown San Francisco. A discounted room rate is available for conference attendees.
item.dc:subject: News

item.title: Worldwide Newton Conference 2006
item.description: We are pleased to announce that our next conference will be held in San Francisco, California. It is scheduled directly following Macworld Expo, January 13 - 15, 2006...
item.dc:subject: News

item.title: Worldwide Newton Conference 2004
item.description: The inaugural conference was held in Paris, September 4-5, 2004. Dozens of Newton users and aficionados gathered for lectures, sessions, chat and general fun...
item.dc:subject: News
